description.narrative:
The overall objective of the proposed scoping research would be to identify new types of youth/young people to work with.
The proposed approach will be to identify a young social networker: a young person that we think can be an excellent gatekeeper in connecting us to young individuals and (informal) youth movements that we would not easily be able to get in touch with through our normal ways of working (via local partner organizations).
This young social networker will be asked to identify youth change makers: individuals that have powerful ideas, networks that are working on some kind of social change, etc. With help from a young technical researcher, short interviews will be conducted with these youth/youth movements during a period of one month, asking them about what they want to achieve, how (Oxfam) could support them. We hope for some kind of snowball effect where talking to one young person brings contacts to others etc. There is a great opportunity to connect this activity to a research activity within the4 Empower Youth for Work (EYW) project that will be conducted in collaboration with the Knowledge Hub on Governance and Citizenship (KH G<(>&<)>C). After a desk review around the shifting role of youth initiatives to influence policy in the first upcoming months, an in-depth case studydevelopment will follow around specific successful youth initiatives. What is also envisioned within EYW is to engage in a short exploratory series to engage in the creation of a simple guide to support the EYW countries in developing structures and strategies towork together with young people.

participating-org.narrative: FTDES Forum Tunisien pour les droit Econo

The Tunisian Forum for Economic and Social Rights (FTDES) is a Tunisian organization declared in the Official Gazette in 2011. It was created in 2011 in order to defend the economic and social rights of the population nationally and internationally. The FTDES working on the following themes: labor law, women's rights, environmental rights and rights of migrants. The FTDES is a member of various international networks including FIDH, Migreurop, Loujna Tounkaranké, Boats 4 People. The FTDES HQ is in Tunis and works under the direction of a steering committee. It has several dozen members across Tunisia and more than twenty employees. The FTDES has chapters in the cities of Kairouan, Kasserine, Gafsa and Monastir.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
